    class 
    Lemniscate
    A parameterization of a scaled Bernoullian lemniscate whose
    curvature is given by
    κ(t) = ((3*√2)*cos(t))/(scale*√(3-cos(2t)))
    and its tangential angle by
    φ(t) = 3*tan^⁻¹(sin(t))
    class 
    RectangularHyperbola
    A parameterization of a rectangular unit hyperbola where t ranges over -Pi to Pi: sec(t)+itan(t) TODO: add scale factor

  • Uses of RealToComplexFunction in arb.operators

    Classes in arb.operators with type parameters of type RealToComplexFunction
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    LaplaceTransform<F extends RealToComplexFunction>
    the Laplace transform is an integral transform that converts a function of a real variable t to a function of a complex variable s (in the complex frequency domain, also known as s-domain, or s-plane) and also transforms ordinary differential equations into algebraic equations and convolution into multiplication.[1][2] For suitable functions f, the Laplace transform is the integral ∫f(t)*e^(-t*s)dt=0..∞)
    Subinterfaces of RealToComplexFunction in arb.operators

    Classes in arb.operators that implement RealToComplexFunction
    Modifier and Type
    Class

    class 
    FourierTransform<F extends RealFunction>
     
    class 
    LaplaceTransform<F extends RealToComplexFunction>
    the Laplace transform is an integral transform that converts a function of a real variable t to a function of a complex variable s (in the complex frequency domain, also known as s-domain, or s-plane) and also transforms ordinary differential equations into algebraic equations and convolution into multiplication.[1][2] For suitable functions f, the Laplace transform is the integral ∫f(t)*e^(-t*s)dt=0..∞)
